description: [allAfrica] Monrovia -- Former Mauritanian finance minister, Sidi Ould Tah, was elected president of the Africa Development Bank, the AfDB announced. Tah, who also headed the Arab Bank for Economic Development in Africa, won after three rounds of voting by the AfDB's Board of Governors at their meeting in Abidjan, securing more than 76% of the votes in the end, according to reports.
title: Africa: Former Mauritanian Finance Minister Tah Elected President of AfDB

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa, Berlin, Geneva -- The World Health Organization (WHO), Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) and the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) announced today the expansion of the successful Health Security Partnership to Strengthen Disease Surveillance in Africa (HSPA) to seven countries on the continent.
title: Africa: WHO, Africa CDC and RKI Expand Unique Partnership to Strengthen Collaborative Surveillance in Africa

description: [UN News] The 78th World Health Assembly concluded Tuesday in Geneva, marking several major milestones in global health. Delegates adopted the world's first pandemic agreement and approved a significant boost in core funding for the World Health Organization (WHO).
title: Africa: Pandemics to Pollution - WHO Assembly Delivers Landmark Health Decisions

description: [New Times] The announcement of deep cuts in US development assistance has cast a long shadow over Africa's infrastructure ambitions. The African Development Fund, the continent's principal vehicle for concessional financing, now faces a possible 37% drop in donor contributions, with Washington potentially withdrawing entirely, according to the Centre of Global Development.
title: Africa: When Aid Shrinks, Execution Must Rise

description: [New Times] As hundreds of Africa's top financial minds as well as policymakers and other stakeholders convene this week in Abidjan for the African Development Bank (AfDB) Group's 2025 Annual Meetings, the urgency of their task cannot be overstated.
title: Africa: Africa Must Finance Her Future, and That Is Now!

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - May 29, 2025

description: [Leadership] Member of Parliament of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Dr. Zainab Gimba, has blamed the rising spate of terrorism and violent extremism in Nigeria, West Africa and the Sahel on the withdrawal of Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger from the ECOWAS bloc.
title: Africa: Ecowas MP Blames Rising Terrorism in West Africa On Exit of Burkina Faso, Mali, Niger

description: [New Times] Kefa Karake, a 35-year-old Rwandan man, is making a name for himself by building high-quality rubber-floor basketball courts, not only in his country but in nations like South Africa, Angola, South Sudan, and beyond.
title: Africa: How Rwandan Man Is Building Top Basketball Courts All Over Africa

description: [UNFPA] United Nations, New York -- In 2025, as crises multiply and conflicts become increasingly protracted, humanitarian aid budgets are being slashed across the board. Yet in many emergency settings, it is ordinary people - and especially women and girls - who are feeling the sharpest impact of these cuts.
title: Africa: Don't Let the Lights Go Out - UNFPA Urges Support for Women and Girls in the World's Most Neglected Crises

description: [WHO-AFRO] Geneva -- The World Health Organization (WHO) Executive Board today appointed Professor Mohamed Yakub Janabi as Regional Director of WHO African Region following his nomination during a Special Session of the WHO Regional Committee for Africa held on 18 May 2025 in Geneva, Switzerland.
title: Africa: Professor Mohamed Yakub Janabi Appointed WHO Regional Director for Africa

description: [New Times] Africa's economic growth is expected to increase from 3.3 per cent in 2024 to 3.9 per cent in 2025, going up to 4.0 per cent in 2026, according to the African Development Bank's (AfDB) African Economic Outlook 2025 released on Tuesday, May 27.
title: Africa: AfDB Lowers Africa's Economic Growth Forecast Amid Global Tariff Tensions

description: [New Times] The International Congress and Convention Association (ICCA) has ranked Kigali as the second most popular city for hosting international meetings and events and Rwanda as the third country in Africa.
title: Africa: Kigali Ranked Africa's Second Most Popular Destination for Meetings

description: [New Times] African countries are urged to create rules and policies reflecting daily realities and priorities while making strategic and inclusive tax models rather than being recipients of global tax reforms.
title: Africa: How Can Africa Contribute to Global Tax Reforms, Align Tax Rules With Local Realities?

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The United States has reaffirmed its commitment to strengthening security partnerships across Africa, emphasizing that the continent's stability is crucial to global peace and prosperity.
title: Africa: When Africa Is Secure, the Region Is More Stable and the World Safer - Dillard

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- US Africa Command (AFRICOM) Commander General Michael Langley has called on African nations to deepen cooperation in the face of rising threats across the continent, urging a united approach to security and stability.
title: Africa: Langley Roots for African Unity in Confronting Shared Threats

description: [African Union] H.E. @ymahmoudali, Chairperson of the AU Commission, today received H.E. Lady Justice Imani Daud Aboud, President of the African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights. Discussions highlighted the Court's jurisprudential and institutional milestones since its inception. Justice Aboud underscored the need for enhanced cooperation by AU Member States.
title: Africa: AUC Chairperson Received H.E. Lady Justice Imani Daud Aboud, President of the African Court On Human and Peoples' Rights

description: [New Times] East Africa is projected to lead the continent in economic growth, with gross domestic product (GDP)expected to increase from 4.3 per cent in 2024 to 5.9 per cent in both 2025 and 2026, according to the African Development Bank's (AfDB) African Economic Outlook 2025.
title: Africa: Effective Policies, Investments Will Drive East Africa's Economic Growth - AfDB Official

description: [UN News] An Indigenous social worker from Canada and a social entrepreneur from Kenya are the laureates of the 2025 Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela Prize, the United Nations announced on Wednesday.
title: Africa: UN Awards 2025 Mandela Prize to Brenda Reynolds and Kennedy Odede

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa, Ethiopia | -- The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC), in collaboration with the African Society for Laboratory Medicine (ASLM), has completed a five-year review of its Biosafety and Biosecurity Initiative. The review paves the way for a new continental strategy to strengthen Africa's preparedness and response to accidental and deliberate biological threats to health, security, and economic stability.
title: Africa: Africa Charts New Biosafety and Biosecurity Strategy to Tackle Cross-Border Threats

description: [UN News] In early summer 2024, Squadron Leader Sharon Mwinsote Syme of Ghana ventured into sector North of Abyei, a disputed region between Sudan and South Sudan where she was deployed as a military gender advocate with the UN Interim Security Force in Abyei (UNISFA).
title: Africa: 'We Are Women Like You' - UN Honours Peacekeepers for Work in Gender Empowerment

description: [UN News] Countries are uniting in the French city of Nice next month to save the marine environment.
title: Africa: UN Aims to Transform Urgency Into Action At Nice Ocean Conference
